trans-unit.source: The exception that is thrown when a call is made to a communication object that has faulted.
A <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationObjectFaultedException> is thrown when a call is made to a faulted communication object.
<xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationObjectFaultedException> is a derived class of <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationException?displayProperty=fullName> and can occur in correct applications.

Because typically the code that calls the <xref:System.ServiceModel.ICommunicationObject.Abort%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method reports the error condition that caused the call to <xref:System.ServiceModel.ICommunicationObject.Abort%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, this exception indicates that the call failed but the most useful error information is elsewhere.
If an object is faulted with several pending calls, only one call throws a specific exception; the others throw <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationObjectFaultedException>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.CommunicationObjectFaultedException"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.CommunicationObjectFaultedException"></xref> class using the specified message.
Creates a new <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationObjectFaultedException> using the specified `message`.
The message that describes the exception.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.CommunicationObjectFaultedException"></xref> class when deserializing a stream using the specified <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> and <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> objects.
This constructor is called when deserializing a <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationObjectFaultedException> object from a stream.
The serialization information used to create the exception object.
The context within which the exception object is created.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.CommunicationObjectFaultedException"></xref> class using the specified message and inner exception.
Creates a new <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationObjectFaultedException> using the specified `message` and `innerException`.
